definition: to take a taxi (in town)/to hitch a lift
dozen (loanword)
to beat/to strike/to hit/to break/to type/to mix up/to build/to fight/to fetch/to make/to tie up/to issue/to shoot/to calculate/to play (a game)/since/from
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
surname Che
war chariot (archaic)/rook (in Chinese chess)/rook (in chess)

sentences.english: It took only half an hour by taxi from Congjiang county to Basha.
sentences.chinese: 從江縣城打車到岜沙，只不過半個小時車程。

sentences.english: B: Not yet. I'll report the taxi and meal expenses later today.
sentences.chinese: 還沒有，我今天晚些時候連打車和喫飯一起報銷。

sentences.english: Not yet. I'll report the taximeal expenses later today.
sentences.chinese: 還沒有，我今天晚些時候連打車和喫飯一起報銷。

sentences.english: The singer left home and hailed a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 歌星出了家門，打車去酒店。

sentences.english: A: How about walking to the concert instead of taking a taxi?
sentences.chinese: 我們不打車，而是走着去音樂會怎麼樣？

sentences.english: Let's go to East Tomb Park by taxi.
sentences.chinese: 讓我們打車去東陵公園吧。

sentences.english: because they have cars or can afford to take taxis everywhere.
sentences.chinese: 因爲他們有車或者他們隨處都可以打車。

sentences.english: How much should it cost to the Kunlun Hotel?
sentences.chinese: 打車到崑崙飯店需要多少錢？

sentences.english: Make sure you take enough money for the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 確認一下你打車的錢帶夠了沒有。

sentences.english: Finally I decided to go there by taxi.
The buses and subway are all very convenient. You may also take a taxi.
sentences.chinese: 北京的公交車和地鐵很方便，偶爾也可以打車。

sentences.english: Shichahai is not far away from here. We can get there by taxi.
sentences.chinese: 什剎海離這兒不太遠，我們可以打車去。

sentences.english: The Didi Chuxing car-hailing app has more than 87% of the market in China.
sentences.chinese: 滴滴出行打車軟件在中國的市場佔有率超過87%。

sentences.english: but now that I live in the city I prefer to take the taxi.
sentences.chinese: 但自從住在城市裏後，我比較喜歡打車了。

sentences.english: It's really unfair, ' the user said, adding, 'who is going to pay for my taxi?
sentences.chinese: 如果打車，一次就是幾十塊，我們的經濟損失誰來管？

to get off or out of (a bus, train, car etc)
to go out/to leave home/to go on a journey/away from home/(of a woman) to get married
to set off/to start (on a journey)
to get on or into (a bus, train, car etc)
this side/here
